Reviews.Content: Bedbugs!!!       Bedbugs and blood
Reviews.Author: IrelandAndrew

Reviews.Content: Very Enjoyable Stay! My girlfriend and I booked this hotel well before any of these bad reviews were posted and were very concerned about the place. Entirely Without Reason!! We really enjoyed our stay there and would definitely stay there again. The hotel was in good condition, our room was very clean, we used the airconditioning 24/7 (we arrived during the recent heatwave, 35-39 degrees!) and it worked well. The hotel is a very short walk from the railway station and was suprisingly quiet! In fact it was lovely to wake up to the distant toll of church bells. Our room overlooked the lovely roof garden  we could see the roof of the San Lorenzo chapel and the Duomo. The hotel is perfectly placed to visit the plethora of attractions of Florence - everywhere is in very easy walking distance. I must take issue with a few things in previous reviews. The staff were as friendly and helpful as all Italians are. Like all people if you are polite they will respond in kind! Italians are animated and vocal in conversation - this could be why one reviewer believed the hotel staff were arguing outside their room. The staff only worked on the corridors after 8am on vacant rooms. You really should be out of bed by then - go enjoy Florence! The buffet breakfast was excellent. The staff coped well when the place was full. We saw only one homeless person (well behaved too) near the hotel through the week - hardly a problem. Italy is a country of many smokers - there is bound to be one crafty smoker among the hotel staff. Italians cannot smoke in restaurants or bars anymore so this is not a problem. I don't smoke but I think a little more tolerance  appreciation of the fact that you are in a different country with a whole different culture is needed. Relax  enjoy.
Reviews.Author: HullJohn

Reviews.Content: Convenient, lovely room but disappointing We had asked for a triple room and were impressed by the size of the accomodation (with balcony) and a shower room AND bathroom, but the amenities advertised were not available, such as the restaurant on any night, or the piano bar only staffed on the one night we asked at reception if it was available. the phone had to be replaced eventually as it did not work, and none of the plugs were conventional fittings even with the adaptor from reception. The rooms to the front of the hotel were exceptionally noisy due to the bus stops outside, and the waste bins being constantly used during the night. With no double glazing it was impossible to get a good nights sleep.Otherwise a good central hotel.
Reviews.Author: ameliaUK

Reviews.Content: Ewwwwwwwwwwww Dilapidated hotel. Rude staff. Elevators broken. Hot water knob didn't work. TV didn't come on. Carpets filthy. Outer bedding looked unwashed. Housekeeping having lengthy arguments in the hallway outside your door. Breakfast--found a hair in food Ew. Bar lacked essentials and often not staffed. View from room was the metal security grates like they pull down at the mall to close up shop. This hotel, which will never be updated because of the money it generates as is, needs one thing: a match. Florence was lovely. Stay elsewhere.
Reviews.Author: doodlebug99

Reviews.Content: Very Disappointed While the location to the train station is a definite plus, the hotel certainly doesn't live up to it's 4-star rating. We were very disappointed when we walked into the tired, smelly lobby to check in. The rooms were average European-sized rooms, but they, too were tired and in dire need of repair. The air conditioning did not work. The shower did not work. The refrigerator did not work. But the cash register sure worked when they charged us the full reservation price for our stay! We'll go elsewhere next time.
Reviews.Author: Wayfareed

Reviews.Content: Not Nice Just back from a two night sleepless stay. The hotel is in a great location but if you have time I would recommend that you change your hotel destination. we read the previous reviews and thought that it would be fine .... But.......... two nights no sleep a piece of ply-board holding our two beds together.... loads of noise from outside..as the room was so hot we had to have the window open and therefore either felt that we were being bitten all night from bed bugs or mozzie's. good luck!
Reviews.Author: orewa01

Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money! The hotel is tired and in need of refurbishment.HOWEVER, we spent two very quiet nights in a spacious room facing on to the garden at the back. Bathroom was clean with working bath. Staff was helpful and polite. Special mention for their buffet breakfast which was bountiful and varied. Given the extremely convenient location, I would not hesitate to recommend it to everyone looking for real value for money.
Reviews.Author: Anna11London

Reviews.Content: Bad We had booked this hotel for our stay in Florence. After reading the reviews on tripadvisor, I canceled my booking at the Majestic.Nevertheless, I went to check out the hotel when I was in Florence. It was worse than the reviews given. Its a dirty, smelly hotel which badly needs refurbishment.I am thankful to all those people who advised not to stay there.
Reviews.Author: shiulee

Reviews.Content: OK but very hot Room was very nice, we had Two bathrooms and it was clean, but the air conditioner would not work, nor did the phones. The room got afternoon sun and the temperature in the room was 35 degrees C., in March. I would not want to be here in summer.Others in our group were not so lucky, one had some type of insect that they thought looked like cockroaches. I had the unfortunate experience of having lost a credit card and needed to use the phones. The one in my room wouldn't work, so I had to use the front desk phone. The staff were surly and very unhelpful in my case, telling me to use the phone in my room.They changed my phone three times before determining that the phone line didn't work, and at least three other rooms in our group had the same phone problem. Not only did the staff not apologize,but they still gave me a hard time when I asked to use the front desk phone to complete my calls. I used a phone card, so it did not cost them anything.It was a good location, right across from the train station., but not much else.
Reviews.Author: camac53

Reviews.Content: NOT AS BAD AS PEOPLE MAKE OUT. I think people are over-reacting. It may not be the Ritz Carlton but you get what you pay for. I paid 42 pounds to stay here for 2 nights. This price cannot be beaten. The rooms are a good size, very clean, beds are fine, no bugs for me. It is only a stones throw from the station, close to restaurants, bars, shops and only a short walk away from the Duomo. I found the staff to be excellent, and very polite. I would recommend this to anybody who wants to stay in a friendly, clean hotel.
Reviews.Author: bluestu127

Reviews.Content: bed bugs alert We arrived from the train station in minutes, very easy walk. Location was good and hotel looked okay although a little run down.We had booked scenic room and were shown to a small hot box with a view of a wll about 6 feet away from the window! Afer much complaining and discussion with receptionist we got a larger room overlooking the piazza on the 4th floor.We had a lovely evening in fantastic Florence and returned for a good nights sleep. We were both woken a short time later feeling itchy and as if we were not alone. With the light on we could see hundreds of bed bugs, small to large covering our pillows. I phoned reception and the porter arrived, he did not seem suprised and asked!! if we wanted to move. He showd me to a small, hot box of a room which i refused. He made several phone calls and argued with the receptionist and evntually we got a newly refurbished room on the first floor with a view and new bed. This represented a good 3* room.The manager never contacted us and no one made any apologies or checked if we were okay. It was only a 3 night stay so we did not complain. When we booked out the receptionist just shrugged and said we would not be charged for upgrading to the last room !!! We will go back to Florence it was a wonderful city, but never to that hotel and i would suggest no one else go there unless they have an interest in entomology.
Reviews.Author: CatinSurrey

Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for We have just returned from a 5 day and 4 night stay at the Grand Hotel Majestic in Florence. The hotel is ideally located near the centre of Florence, 5 mins walk away from the cathedral, and very close to a reasonably priced supermarket. We had two double rooms on the first floor, these were very spacious, had large comfy beds, a useful safe in each room, satellite tv. The adjoining bathrooms were also well equipped with free hair dryers and bath/showers. On the whole the hotel was a very good deal for the small amount we paid. The cleanliess was somewhat doubtful when we found a dirty toilet on the day we arrived, a splatter mark up the side of our bedroom wall, and stains on the carpets. The staff were quite abrupt and unfrienly but nonetheless helpful to us. Our stay included a buffet breakfast which I can only describe as excellent, there was a good variety of continental foods, cereals and fruit juices, tea, coffee. All in all you get what you pay for and this was a very good deal.
Reviews.Author: UKtrekker24

Reviews.Content: Can 4* be that bad?!       A room with a view NOT!
Reviews.Author: KandaScotland

Reviews.Content: Good Location, Safe Parking, Not Much Else This was a last minute reservation, so I didn't do as much research as I should have, but the website I used listed this hotel as a 4-star establishment. Due to the fact that it had on-site parking and a few reviews mentioned the friendly staff and great location, I went for it. The garage hotel's garage closed for business at night and on Sundays, so we had to ask the reception desk for access during those hours. While it seemed a bit expensive at 25 Euros per day, I at least felt that my car was in a safe place. The hotel looks like it was probably very nice once upon a time, but I don't think it has been renovated in many years. There were a couple of key items that were were inadequate or broken.- The bathroom didn't have a full shower; just a tub with a hand-held sprayer that was broken so it sprayed in several directions- The elevator from the parking garage to the lobby was out of service- The elevator from the lobby to the rooms was broken, which was a problem for the elderly traveller with meI definitely want to visit Florence again, but I won't be staying here.
Reviews.Author: tericee

Reviews.Content: Noisy but great value My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 3-nights at the end of November 2007. I booked the hotel on the web before reading the very negative reviews posted on this site, nevertheless like true Brits we decided to honour our booking. Generally we found the hotel perfectly ok, the rooms whilst not benefiting from the most up-to the minute decor were fine, clean and with plenty of space. However like most of the City the hint of drains was always present. Breakfast was OK and service was as friendly as we found anywhere in Italy. In summary for the 60 euros per night we paid for this hotel it was great value. However one word of warning, the outside noise was a bit of a nuisance.
Reviews.Author: Sir_JackEngland

Reviews.Content: Stay away - bed bugs! Our 5-night stay at this hotel was terrible! When we arrived, we immediately were greeted by an awful moldy odour in the lobby. Upon entering our adjoining rooms, we faced many amenities that did not work - one of the doors, the phone, the TV. Even the air conditioning was weak at best. The hotel staff was extremely unresponsive to our complaints. However, the worst part was the discovery of bed bugs. The first few nights, we were waking up with small red marks all over our body. Not being familiar with bed bugs, we were unsure as to what these welts were and were unconcerned. However, waking up after our fourth night - we were both comletely covered in welts all over our bodies. I had at least 40 or so bites all over! At this point, we knew something was up. We switched hotel rooms, only to find an actual bug crawling the wall of our new room. The hotel staff denied a bug problem, even though we even saw maids carrying bottles of RAID on their carts. Needless to say, we left the hotel itchy, swollen, voilated, and uncompensated. NEVER STAY HERE!!!
Reviews.Author: bert6

Reviews.Content: Not so bad but not so grand       Room with a view...
Reviews.Author: JayneAndD

Reviews.Content: We are not sure what to say. We had come in from Rome to stay in Florence. The room here was very large but in real need of remodeling and cleaning. We had our 2 teens with us and were given ajoining rooms, it then had a total of 4 baths for 4 people, not bad. Our mattress had a piece of particle board under it ???? not sure what that was about, but really wierd. I told my husband this was probably the place the stars stayed back in the day but not anymore - needs remodeling badly, stained carpets etc. The woodwork was coming off of the baseboard. We did not use the elevator because it took too long to call. I was able to use the internet to check e-mail, but on the last night of our stay they told me it was now 5 euro an hour, I told them I only needed a couple minutes, but an hour was the minimum required. Unfotunatly I do not know the exact price of this hotel because it was booked in a lump sum with all of our trip, but I know that it was more than what we spend in the U.S. for a beautiful place.
Reviews.Author: Flosstoday

Reviews.Content: Smelly Majestic The room was booked by a travel agency for a conference that was taking place there so we couldn't choose a different hotel. I was prepared what to expect after reading the reviews on the tripadvisor, but I was hoping not to be so bad as we had to stay there 4 nights. The facade of the building was so ugly and out of character and the smell of urine took as right away. In addition, there were empty bottles of beers in front of the building and some strange guys hanging there!After doing the check-in a guy grabbed our luggages in an impolite way dragging them in an elevetor and using gestrures he tried to show us to take the other elevetor across the lobby. Another girl who was quite impolite took us to our room eventually!The room seemed not being renovated for the last 20 years. The matress was so old that you had the feeling that you will fall down. The blanket had almost no wool on it and was filthy! And of course there was that mixed smell of humidity and oldness that was all over the hotel. The good thing was that they were changing all the towels everyday but they didn't have a fresh smell. They had the smelll of being closed in the closet for some years!!! You could only stand in this room with the window open (fortunately the weather was great) but the noise coming from the street was unbearable. There were always fights going on from the drunk people sitting outside the hotel! The breakfast was very basic and boring, but you could get an espresso if you were asking for one.This is not a 4-star hotel (for sure) and I don't know how they are getting the stars but they should be more strict.
Reviews.Author: fuorio

Reviews.Content: Nothing Majestic About It! I was on a Globus tour (Grand Tour of Italy  Sicily) and the tour group was booked into this hotel for one night. Thank goodness it was only one night for it was the longest night of my life!When we were able to get into our rooms my mother and I did the once over and just looked at each other and laughed. We thought it was a joke or something because our hotel in Rome had been so nice; it was literally one extreme to the next!While checking out the bathroom I touched the shower door and it literally broke in my hand; came right off the hinge and there was a huge piece of porcelin missing from the top of the toilet. My aunt and uncle were also on tour with us and the toilet in their room had no water in the tank so it couldn't be flushed. My aunt called down to the front desk to tell them about it as soon as we arrived and was told someone would be up to fix it, however no one ever arrived. I also told them about the shower door in our room but didn't see anyone to fix that before we left the following morning. Oh, and there is a piece of plywood between the boxspring and the mattress. Not sure exactly what this is for but... The hotel is in serious need of a remodel or needs to be abandoned!!! Also, the same girl that checked us in at 3 p.m. was still on duty at 7 a.m. the next morning when I turned in our key. Later in the evening the entire hotel was overcome with the unbearable stench of sewer which was unescapable. We did get an explanation regarding the air conditioning from our tour director. Believe it or not because of all of the energy saving that Italy is involved in, air conditioning is strictly regulated  is prohibited from being turned on before May 1st! So even if your hotel has air conditioning and it's hot before May 1st, you won't be able to use it in your hotel room because they aren't allowed to turn it on. With that said we were in Italy during the middle of a spring heatwave and had the same problems with the excessive noise, street cleaners, etc with the windows open. Even with the windows closed the noise was very loud and everyone on my tour (42 people in all) had a very restless night at the Grand Hotel Majestic.
Reviews.Author: LuvMyTwins

Reviews.Content: Rip-Off We PAID 20 Euros a day for secured underground parking attendance at Grand Hotel Majestic and on the second day when we went to pick up our car there was an enormous dent on the rear passengerside door that no one could explain. Even though they have the area video taped and supervised with an attendant, they refused to show us what happened or take responsibility for the hit and run. And in the end still charged us the full 40 Euros for the 2 days of parking. I wish I could sue them!!! DO NOT GO HERE. They will rip you off and ruin your car.
Reviews.Author: d1baker

Reviews.Content: JoandMel As we entered this hotel, the smell was overpowering. t is hard to say what it was but it was not nice. I did them a huge favour by leaving te front door open!The building is old but not a good old. Our room did not have a minibar as it was being repaired. They did move us without any fuss. Room was hot but not allowed to have air con on. We left the windows open for air but the sparrow sized mozzies feasted on us all night and the noise outside was unbearable.The stench of urine outside the motel (as well as the station) was nothing short of putrid. If the hotel staff know alcoholics will urinate on their site then they should grab a watering can - this would not be a waste of water!!The positive for this motel was thesize of the room and bathroom and the location. Very close to station and tourist meeting points. In saying that I would look around for another motel.
Reviews.Author: JoandMel

Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here I only stayed in this hotel for one evening...and that was one evening too many.I booked this hotel for a single evening so that we would have accommodations in Florence after returning from a brief excursion from Florence to Venice...and before flying back home the next day.What we asked (and paid for):- A smoke-free room- A triple- A four star hotelWhat we got when we checked in around 10pm:- A room that smelled like it had been smoked in non-stop. Apparently, smoke-free meant that no one would be smoking in it when we checked in.- Two twin beds cramped together and a cot near the window, which pretty much occupied 75% of the hotel room's usable walking space.- A room that was 90 degrees plus when we checked in...and no ability to turn on air conditioning.- A deafening noise level from the street, only made worse when the windows were opened to counter the stifling heat.We called the front desk and asked for help. We mentioned the heat and they said to open the window. We mentioned the noise level, and they said close the window. We inquired about air conditioning and they said no dice. We asked about moving rooms and they said none were available. To make issues worse, they were fairly rude. I suppose if this was a budget hotel, perhaps their attitude would have been understandable...PERHAPS...but this is (supposedly) a four star hotel...and a hotel that is NOT inexpensive.I cannot stress how loud the neighborhood is. The hotel is across the street from the train station...but the train noise is nothing compared to the noise of cars, scooters, people yelling, street sweepers glacially cleaning the parking lot beneath our window for OVER TWO HOURS between 10pm and midnight, and (I am not kidding) someone banging on a pipe at 2:00 AM...for the better part of an hour.My wife and daughter were miserable...and we each managed to only sleep for an hour or so all evening. Save your money. Sleep on a bench in the train station. You'll be happier...even if you have to pay the same expense.
Reviews.Author: Nova_Steve

Reviews.Content: wouldnt stay here again We stayed in a3* in Rome for two days, then two nights at the Grand Majestic in Florence.My boyfriend booked this up for a xmas present and he just was told the price and that it was a 4*, so he thought it must be a decent hotel which a good location. If only he read the reviews on here first!Comming from a perfect, lovely 3* hotel which cost half the price of this one, we were expecting something a bit more special for this 4* rated hotel.We was wrong! The location is the only thing good about this hotel. It is pretty much right next to the Santa Maria station which is Florence main train station so you can always find your way back or get taxis easily ect. The hotel is extemely old and crusty. The outside looks pretty much how the inside will look! The rooms are big - i will give it that but it was filthy! It had such a horrible perfum smell when we first walked in -probably sprayed by a cleaner to avoid proper cleaning! The bathroom was horrible. Had only a bath with a shower bit that you had to hold. The bathroom was pretty clean, but just looked like a bathroom that hadnt seen a decorator for 70years. The tiles had crack and just looked like a bath you really didnt want to get in.If i had payed a low amount for this hotel, it wouldnt had been so bad as at least the room was big and the location good. But for 拢100 per room for the two of us, we thought it was a joke!We just made the best of it as we were only there for two days anyway and as it was a lovely present for me, i didnt want to moan. We both felt let down by this hotel though.Florence is such a lovely place and that was the highlight for us, defo not the hotel.The breakfast was ok, pretty much the same for many hotels. Beware of the scrambled egg that had one moring, it didnt look nice at all!!I wouldnt go back here. This hotel needs alot of desperate work! The rooms are overpriced, dusty, old and smells weird. There will be much more cheaper and nicer hotels about -trust me!!
Reviews.Author: kazprincess

Reviews.Content: Terrible - Completely ruined our New Year vacation We were a group of 6 people ( 3 double rooms). The reasons we had chosen the Grand Majestic were that a) it had a closed garage b) it accepted pets c) it is walking distance to the centre of Florence. The rooms were booked and pre-paid since the 15th of November 2006 ( 鈧?3000 total). Two of us checked - in the hotel on December 28th and the rest of the group (4 adults and a dog) arrived on December 30th at 22:00 only to be informed that the hotel was overbooked.The hotel staff very rudely infromed us that they would either relocate half of our group in a hotel 5 km away or else return our money and leave us without a room one day before New Year's eve.The hotel they offered to relocate us to did not accept pets and was not walking distance from Florence.When we protested and asked for Tourist Police they completely ignored us. Never apologised and thy did not compensate our trouble in anyway.stay away!!!
Reviews.Author: Masi4

Reviews.Content: Needs Renovation Old, outdated and poor value. Badly in need of renovations.
Reviews.Author: Richmond_Traveller

Reviews.Content: not a four star hotel the location of this hotel is fantastic. everything else about the majestic hotel was not worth the money. run down rooms with broken window shades, an exposed electric socket, a bed with a matress 4 inches thick supported by a plywood board, and oodles of homeless drinking out front. hotel baglioni was way better and just across the street.
Reviews.Author: sammd

Reviews.Content: Not as bad as I thought it would be I spent 4 days at this hotel at the end of July. I had read all the other reviews before I arrived so I knew what to expect. However, the hotel is not as bad as the worst of the reviews, but certainly not as good as some of the others.On the plus side my room was of a good size, had plenty of storage space and a large bathroom.But - there was a lot of mould around the shower, a thick layer of dust on the tissue holder behind the bathroom door and lots of greasy fingerprints over the stainless steel toilet rool holder.Similarly, in the bedroom there was a thick layer of dust on both window sills (behind the net curtains!), a couple of glasses and a packet of nuts on a very dirty serviette beside the television, and - again - lots of greasy fingerprints on the control panel for the radio (which did not work) behind the bed. Like many of the other reviewers mentioned, the mattress on my bed also had a suicidal tilt.........The air conditioning also did not keep the room cool - although, to be fair - the temperature in Florence was nearly 40 degrees while I was there.Breakfast in the dining room was OK - but I did notice ants crawling on the table by the open bowls of jam one morning.My overall impression was that the hotel certainly had seen better days and was sorely in need of a complete revamp. It has the potential to be a really nice hotel - it is in a very convenient position for all the major sights (and the railway station), but as things are at the moment I certainly would not stay there again.
Reviews.Author: Ex-skiier

Reviews.Content: Check Out!!! On the hottest 2 days in Florence (98), this hotel offered NO air conditioning anywhere. Fans were blowing, but there was no escape from the heat, even after management changed our rooms and others up to 4 times. Beds were disgracefully tilted and worn out; if cleanliness is next to Godliness, this hotel is hell. You could smell the rot and decay of a hotel that has been sadly neglected. People were stuck in the elevator for 45 minutes in this extreme heat, and no rescue personnel were on hand. Our Globus tour guide told us as we left that Globus would not use this hotel again. Make sure you are not booked here or insist on other accommodations.
Reviews.Author: sleaman

Reviews.Content: Not that bad!! We stayed at this hotel in July 06, and I was a bit worried having read the review below before we left!The hotel is a fallen beauty, yes. It probably was a luxury hotel in the 60ties or 70ties, but nothing seems to have been done since then. But you can still see traces of that majestic hotel it once probably was. We had a nice room with a king size double bed, which was quite comfortable. The room was away from traffic, so we were not bordered bu noice. The AC was struggling hard to keep the room cold in the Florence heat, but it managed. This is more a two star than a four star hotel, mainly because of the need of refurbishing. But it is not that bad, and location is great, it is right in the middle of everything.
